Johannes Link wrote:

>  > I haven't done much research into aspects yet, so I don't really know.
>  > One thing I dislike about the way aspects are implemented is that the
>  > additional compilation step (in Eclipse) disrupts my code, save, test
>  > rythym, and that's enough for me not to learn more about it. When the
>  > day comes that weaving aspects is a seamless part of the Eclipse
>  > experience, I'll look into it more.
> 
> Last time I looked at it, maybe 6 months ago, ajdt (the Eclipse
> AspectJ-Plugin) came with an incremental aspect weaver which worked
> invisibly during an automatic build.

Wow, really? I must be horribly behind the times. Thanks.
